news-item.title: Semafo rises 2.8% from 14-day low
news-item.text:
Semafo Inc. (TSX:SMF) was up 2.8% from its 14-day low of CAD4.23 on 20 March, 2014. Its Williams % R is -81.7. A reading of between -80 and -100 suggests it is near its 14-day low. This is defined as oversold, a bullish signal. The stock price increased 5.0c (or 1.2%) to close at CAD4.35, ending a three-day streak of losses. Compared with the S&P/TSX 60 Index which rose 2.2 points (or 0.3%) in the day, this represented a relative price increase of 0.9%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Semafo, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/001051821580314285 Bullish SignalsUptrend- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 4.48 minus the 26-day EMA of 4.35 is positive 0.13 suggesting a bullish signal.- In the last three months the stock has hit a new 52-week high fourteen times, pointing to a significant uptrend. - The present value of CAD1,000 (PV$1000) invested one year ago in Semafo is CAD1,700, including a capital gain of CAD680 and dividend reinvested of CAD21. Oversold/Bullish/Support Signals- The stock is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -81.7, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of CAD4.22. - Open interest decreased -0.6% from 1068 a week ago while the stock tumbled -6.5% from CAD4.57 a week ago, suggesting a strong weekly trend.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Return on Capital Employed 1.9% [0.7%].Other Bullish Signals:- Total Liabilities/EBITDA of 1.4 is comfortably below 5, this compares favourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 13.1%. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 1.5. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- Net profit margin has averaged 19.3% in the last 3 years. This is considered superior and suggests a high margin of safety. Bearish Signals- The price decreased 0.5% in the last month. The stock has been exacerbated by firm volume of 1.3 times average for the month.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price to Book of 1.8 [1.0]. - Dividend yield of 0.5% [1.3%].Other Bearish Signals:- Revenue growth rate has shown signs of deterioration in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
Note- Semafo is at a discount of 11.8% to its 12-month high of CAD4.93 on 17 Mar, 2014. It is also at a premium of 253.7% to the 12-month low of CAD1.23 on 26 Jun, 2013. AGGREGATE VOLUMES, PRICES AND TURNOVER PERIOD [Volume Index or VI in brackets; 1 is average] Toronto: SMF.TSX 2,613,749 [VI of 1.5] volume 89.803% of aggregate. Price: CAD4.35. Stockholm: SMF.STO 282,400 [VI of 0.7] volume 9.703% of aggregate. Price: SEK24.85. Using the current exchange rate of SEK1 equals 0.1756CAD, The shares are at a 0.3% premium to the close price in Toronto. OTC Pink: SEMFF.PINKSHEETS 14,400 [VI of 0.9] volume 0.495% of aggregate. Price: US$3.93. Using the current exchange rate of USD1 equals 1.1163CAD, The shares are at a 0.9% premium to the close price in Toronto. Aggregate volume: there were 2.9 million shares of Semafo worth CAD12.7 million traded. The aggregate volume was 1.4 times average trading of 2.1 million shares. COMPANY ANNOUNCEMENTSThe last 7 company announcements are:March 12: SEMAFO Reports 2013 Cash Flow from Operations of $77.6 Million[News Story] MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(March 12, 2014) - SEMAFO (TSX:SMF)(OMX:SMF) today reported its financial and operational results for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2013. All amounts are in US dollars unless otherwise stated.In the third quarter 2013 SEMAFO determined its two non-core assets, the Samira Hill and Kiniero mines, as discontinued operations in the Corporation's financial statements The Samira Hill mine in Niger was sold during the fourth quarter of 2013 and the Kiniero mine in Guinea was placed in care and maintenance in the first quarter of 2014.The following 2013 year-end and fourth quarter reviews are comprised solely of information and data from ongoing operations at the Mana mine in Burkina Faso.http://www.buysellsignals.net/BuySellSignals/report/Canada/Stock/News/494315.htmlSource: TMX Group March 07: SEMAFO Provides Notice of 2013 Fourth Quarter and Year-End Results Release and Conference Call[News Story] MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(March 7, 2014) - SEMAFO Inc. (TSX:SMF)(OMX:SMF) today announced that the Corporation's 2013 fourth quarter and year-end results will be released on Wednesday, March 12, 2014 prior to TSX market open. The financial statements will be available on the Corporation's website at www.semafo.com or at www.sedar.com.SEMAFO's senior management will host a conference call to discuss the fourth quarter and year-end financial and operational results, as well as to provide an update on the Corporation's activities. February 14: Semafo director sellsSemafo (TSX:SMF) director Vinet, Eric sold 20,000 shares on February 11, 2014. The selling price was CAD2.03. February 14: Semafo director buysSemafo (TSX:SMF) director Vinet, Eric bought 20,000 shares on February 11, 2014. The purchase price was CAD2.03. February 12: Semafo director sellsSemafo (TSX:SMF) director Vinet, Eric sold 10,000 shares on February 11, 2014. The selling price was CAD4.17. December 09: SEMAFO's 2013 Soil Sampling Program Identifies New Priority Drill Targets Within the Kokoi Shear Zone[News Story] MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(Dec. 9, 2013) - SEMAFO (TSX:SMF)(OMX:SMF) today provided an update on its ongoing soil sampling program at Mana, Burkina Faso, which has identified a strong and continuous north-trending corridor within the Kokoi shear zone measuring more than 14 kilometers long and up to four kilometers wide. December 02: SEMAFO Sells Its Interest in the Samira Hill Mine in Niger[News Story] MONTREAL, QUEBEC--(Dec. 2, 2013) - SEMAFO Inc. (TSX:SMF)(OMX:SMF) today announced the closing of the sale of its 80% interest in Societe des Mines du Liptako S.A. ("SML") to Societe de Patrimoine des Mines du Niger S.A.("SOPAMIN").African GeoMin Mining Development Corporation Limited ("AGMDC"), a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of SEMAFO, sold to SOPAMIN its 80% interest in SML, owner of the Samira Hill mine in Niger, as well as its exploration permits.On closing of the transaction, SEMAFO received a cash payment of US$1.25 million and retained a fixed net smelter return ("NSR") royalty of 1.2% on all gold production from the Samira Hill plant payable by SOPAMIN to SEMAFO. ISIN: CA8169221089 T:SMF; TSE:SMF; N:SMF; CN:SMF Source: www.BuySellSignals.com
